https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.long_instructions:
_When you read this poem, what feeling do you get? What color matches that feeling?_

-   Connect blocks from the toolbox under `when run` to build your program. 
-   Find a **background** and **text effect** that matches the **mood** of this poem.
-   Change the **colors** of your effects or text. 
-   Click "Run" to animate the poem.

https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.short_instructions: Let's use events to change the animation when the poem mentions something new.
https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.long_instructions:
Use **events** to change your animation when the poem mentions something new. 

-   Find a **line** in the poem where the mood shifts or something new is introduced. 
-   Add **colors** or **effects** to match a new **line** in the poem. 
-   Make sure the effect changes when the line you want appears on the screen.

https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.short_instructions: Authors use imagery to paint a picture in the reader's mind. You can add sprites to illustrate your poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.long_instructions:
Poets use words to paint a picture in the reader's mind. Add **sprites** to go with the images that come to your mind when you read the poem. 

-   Add a `make new sprite` block to your code.
-   Choose a costume for your sprite.

_Extra Challenge:_ Connect a `make new sprite` block to an event to make a new sprite appear when a new image is introduced in the poem.

authored_hints.location_hint:

[blockly block][0]

-   Click the pin [][1] on the location block then choose a new position for your sprite on the screen.
-   Press the "Run" button when your code is finished.

https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.short_instructions: Sprites can do certain actions or behaviors over and over while the program runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/poem-art-2021/.long_instructions:
Sprites can do certain actions or **behaviors** over and over while the program runs.

-   Add a `sprite begins` block to your code.
-   Explore different sprite behaviors.
-   Choose a behavior that matches your poem.

_Extra Challenge:_ Add a `sprite begins` block to an **event**!

-   Change the size of your sprite by using the new `set size` block.
